channel.title: Anti-leeches..(pain)
channel.description:
okay basically what im just gonna say is this. WHAT IS THE POINT OF ANTI-LEECHES?!
i say that people should use em as much, whats the point in it. because it's like fabjan said ''if you release something, do it good and if ur scared for leechers, dont release''
no matter what you do theres gonna be leechers. anti-leech or no anti-leech, so whats the point in spending time in adding them just to have the files leeched anyway. THERE ISNT ONE!

item.title: Anti-leeches..(pain)
item.dc:creator: @Anfernio Anfernio
item.description:
@Anfernio wrote:

Remove the anti-leech then?

Read full topic

item.title: Anti-leeches..(pain)
item.dc:creator: @bankotsu11 bankotsu11
item.description:
@bankotsu11 wrote:

[quote=“Jc22493, post:24, topic:314134”][quote author=jmood128 link=topic=410612.msg3030711#msg3030711 date=1258355468]
I know of only one Released server that is not leeched, all others even 99% of frame works are leeches because of the stream, cryption and I think the misc class. Because of those classes almost all servers, and frameworks are leeched. I know Hyperion isn’t leeched, but if there are other frameworks that don’t use the cryption and stream class (Well rewrite them of cores).
[/quote]
Some of the bases released are written from scratch, not just one.

@Topic: There is no point. People add this ‘anti-leech’ in for no particular reason. They’re probably simple though, so you can probably figure it out if you ever come across one. :)[/quote]

ehh thats true. but people think that if they spent alot of work on the source, then they should put like 500 anti-leeches in, me and my friend were trying to get a crisis X source. the one we got had atleast 10 100 errors’ then like 100 other errors for other things. we stopped after we did about 30 cuz we didnt think it would be worth the time

Read full topic

item.title: Anti-leeches..(pain)
item.dc:creator: @Tatemo Tatemo
item.description:
@Tatemo wrote:

Didn’t anyone listen? It is for fun

Read full topic

item.title: Anti-leeches..(pain)
item.dc:creator: @zoltanman zoltanman
item.description:
@zoltanman wrote:

If you have to sit there and do that to your code, then don’t release it. It’s an open source community, if you don’t like it. Then just don’t post it to be honest.

Read full topic

item.title: Anti-leeches..(pain)
item.dc:creator: @jc22493 Jc22493
item.description:
@jc22493 wrote:

jmood128:

I know of only one Released server that is not leeched, all others even 99% of frame works are leeches because of the stream, cryption and I think the misc class. Because of those classes almost all servers, and frameworks are leeched. I know Hyperion isn’t leeched, but if there are other frameworks that don’t use the cryption and stream class (Well rewrite them of cores).

Some of the bases released are written from scratch, not just one.

@Topic: There is no point. People add this ‘anti-leech’ in for no particular reason. They’re probably simple though, so you can probably figure it out if you ever come across one.

Read full topic

item.title: Anti-leeches..(pain)
item.dc:creator: @Tatemo Tatemo
item.description:
@Tatemo wrote:

I knew I had too many cs

Read full topic

item.title: Anti-leeches..(pain)
item.dc:creator: @bankotsu11 bankotsu11
item.description:
@bankotsu11 wrote:

[quote=“Tatemo, post:19, topic:314134”]Well, i’ll be. People are always complaining about how nobody ever helps in the help section so I think one point of your arguement is already gone.

I would like to contribute by saying this: Making anti-leeches is fun. As long as you aren’t as creative as a pole you can do all kinds of things. In one of the Ddsspeced versions I know for a fact that if you drink a potion on a certain square you get given unlimited money.

Anti-Leeches don’t neccassarily(How the fuck you spell that I don’t know right now) have to crash or sabotage the server, sometimes they can even be so devious and cunning (Having to dance, then dig whilst talking on a certain square at a certain quest stage at a certain time) that they are never found at all. That is where the fun is.[/quote]

hmm i never thought of it that way.
btw its *necessarily

Read full topic

item.title: Anti-leeches..(pain)
item.dc:creator: @doom_j doom_j
item.description:
@doom_j wrote:

I know of only one Released server that is not leeched, all others even 99% of frame works are leeches because of the stream, cryption and I think the misc class. Because of those classes almost all servers, and frameworks are leeched. I know Hyperion isn’t leeched, but if there are other frameworks that don’t use the cryption and stream class (Well rewrite them of cores).

Read full topic

item.title: Anti-leeches..(pain)
item.dc:creator: @runefreak10 runefreak10
item.description:
@runefreak10 wrote:

95% of this community has leeched. We’re all winterLove based, unless you made your own server from absolutely blank files. Even I have ‘leeched’ you could say because I use what was once the original winterLove server. (if I have it facts correct) But anyways, I say it’s not leeching unless you give credit. No matter how much you change in a source you downloaded, you’re still required to thank the person that you downloaded it from, and all the people they thanked and gave credit to. But to the subject about anti-leeches, they are pointless. It takes one single person to fix it, then everyone else ‘knows’ how to fix it once that person makes a post on how to remove them.

Read full topic

item.title: Anti-leeches..(pain)
item.dc:creator: @Tatemo Tatemo
item.description:
@Tatemo wrote:

Well, i’ll be. People are always complaining about how nobody ever helps in the help section so I think one point of your arguement is already gone.

I would like to contribute by saying this: Making anti-leeches is fun. As long as you aren’t as creative as a pole you can do all kinds of things. In one of the Ddsspeced versions I know for a fact that if you drink a potion on a certain square you get given unlimited money.

Anti-Leeches don’t neccassarily(How the fuck you spell that I don’t know right now) have to crash or sabotage the server, sometimes they can even be so devious and cunning (Having to dance, then dig whilst talking on a certain square at a certain quest stage at a certain time) that they are never found at all. That is where the fun is.

Read full topic

item.title: Anti-leeches..(pain)
item.dc:creator: @r0ckstar96 r0ckstar96
item.description:
@r0ckstar96 wrote:

[quote=“bankotsu11, post:17, topic:314134”]thats what we’re talking about, and anti-leeches fail for many reasons.

1.people can just take em out and still take credit for all the work
2.nooby skilled leechers can just have someone else take them out,
3.someone else will probly just take them out and release the cracked version.[/quote]
Hmm, well you’ve got me there.

Read full topic

[/quote]There’s still the chance that this doesn’t always prevail.[/quote]

theres a chance, but its a slim one.

item.title: Anti-leeches..(pain)
item.dc:creator: @The_Reaper_X The Reaper X
item.description:
@The_Reaper_X wrote:

[quote=“bankotsu11, post:6, topic:314134”]well thats not niceee. god, no need to be sassy…

and i did use it correctly… maybe you just got confused, because i know what im talking about…[/quote]Fact is, people use the term leech so loosely, it means nearly nothing.

You make an anti-leech not because it takes forever and it’s a wast of time, which btw could possible take only a few seconds tbh, but you make it so that you ensure that idiots looking for a quick source don’t get it. If you want to make sure that people that “know how to code” use your source, you can add the anti-leech so that only those kind of people will be able to use it because only they know how to figure out.

Read full topic
